title: Ticket #3725: Really fix gathering pid list on mac os x
description:
On Mac OS X, the sysctl() call is used to gather information for all pids on the system. This call can occasionally fail if the provided buffer is to small to hold the information. Ticket #3617 attempted to fix this by retrying the call several times. Unfortunately, that fix used inaccurate documentation. It assumed sysctl() would return -1 and set errno to ENOMEM when the buffer is too small. Experimentation showed that in this situation, the call returns 0 and sets the oldlenp pointer argument to 0.

We don't know if this same difference in behavior exists on the BSDs.
remarks:
2013-Jul-08 16:42:45 by tlmiller:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good.

I don't know what the first system call is actually required to do, but because realloc( ptr, 0 ) is free( ptr ), at least on Linux, it wouldn't hurt to assert that bufSize is nonzero after the first system call.
